recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Paneer Bhurji is a popular breakfast recipe in north India made with crumbled cheese. It is a famous dish among vegetarians. Its is best enjoyed hot and served with Pav/rotis/phulkas.
It is made with fresh or frozen paneer that is cooked with onion and tomatoes as a base along with other Indian spices. Recipe for making home made fresh Paneer, see Tips section below.

Paneer is a good source of calcium which helps in maintaining strong bones and teeth. It contains calcium along with vitamin D which prevents osteoporosis. It also prevents stomach disorder at an old age.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Heat oil in a wok\kadhai. Add cumin seeds, allow it to crackle Add garlic, fry till it turns slight brown. Garlic should not be burnt.
Add green chillies, fry for 30 sec. Then add onions, fry till it turns brown. Add ginger, Fry for 1 min.
Add turmeric powder and chilli powder. Fry for 45 sec.
Then add tomatoes, cumin powder and garam masala, salt. Fry till tomatoes become soft and oil starts separating.

Its time to add scrambled Paneer. Mix it well. Reduce the flame to medium-low. Cover and cook for 10 mins. In between, keep frying, so that Paneer does not stick to bottom. Remove the lid. Add capsicum, mix it well. Increase the flame to medium. Cook for 5 mins.
Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve hot with rotis\chapati.

tips.tipDesc: You can even use bhurji for as a stuffing for Paneer sandwiches and rolls.
For easy crumble of frozen Paneer, soak it in hot water for 15-20 mins or defrost in microwave for 4-5 mins. This will make it soft and you can easy cut or crumble as needed.

Making fresh paneer is easy. Boil approx 3 cups milk. Then add 2 tbsp lemon juice, milk will start to curdle, if its not happening, add some more lemon juice.  The milk should curdle completely. Keep stirring the milk during this step so the milk does not stick to bottom. Once entire milk has curdled, immediately drain the milk in muslin/cheese cloth. The white portion collected is Paneer. Wait till the water is drained completely. Take a plate and put the muslin cloth with curdled milk. On top of it, place a heavy plate. Let it sit for 45 mins. Remove the Paneer from cloth and is ready to use in your dish.
